Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Lets list the activities in the order they are listed: 1. IG 2. DD 3. TFC 4. CE 5. PC 6. LT 7. UT 8. AG 9. MP 10. FL A common simple model would be that the process starts with IG and ends with FL, and all activities must occur exactly once, and there is a precedence chain: each activity must precede the next.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Typically, every product idea starts with Idea Generation (IG). So we might have an init constraint: IG must be the first activity. All activities might be required to occur at least once ... So we could set existence constraints for all activities. ... exactly_one for all activities. In a product design process, its plausible that each activity happens exactly once per case.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: TFC and CE both depend on DD. So we could have: (DD, TFC) and (DD, CE) as precedence. Also, TFC and CE both precede PC ... PC cannot start before both TFC and CE are done? That would be a response? Or precedence? ... Similarly, after PC, we have LT and UT. They might be independent.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: A reasonable model: init: IG existence for all activities. exactly_one for all? Possibly ... Precedence constraints: (IG, DD) (DD, TFC) and (DD, CE) (TFC, PC) and (CE, PC) (PC, LT) and (PC, UT) (LT, AG) and (UT, AG) (AG, MP) (MP, FL)

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: with existence for both and precedence (AG, MP), we get that AG must happen before MP. ... if PC happens, then TFC and CE must have happened before PC. ... With existence for A and B and precedence(A,B), we get A before B.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: So for every activity X, there is a directed path from X to FL. That means ... all activities must occur before FL ... FL must be the last activity. Similarly for IG being first.

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: But what about exactly_one? ... if there is iteration, then exactly_one would be violated. However, the description doesnt explicitly say that there are iterations. ... So we assume one pass.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Given the complexity, maybe we should stick to a simple chain of succession ... But we have a partial order that enforces that each activity happens after its predecessors.
